title: ELI5: Why do paper mills smell so awful? : r/explainlikeimfive - Reddit
body: A lot of that smell is from effluents from the bleaching process and the busting down of cellulose process. Caustic chemicals and highly corrosive salts are used to turn tree pulp into pillowy soft sheets for your ass. The resulting mess is dangerous and goes through some reactions to lessen the pollution when they dump this shit back into the ...
